title: CliQr Showcases Application-Defined Migration and Management for Amazon Web Services at AWS re:Invent
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/30/2015 @ 5:00 AM   CliQr 
LAS VEGAS, NV -- (Marketwired) -- 09/30/15 -- AWS re:Invent -- CliQr , the leader in application-defined cloud management, invites attendees to see product demonstrations at Booth #803 at AWS re:Invent, Amazon Web Services' global customer and partner conference, at The Venetian on Oct. 6-9. In addition, CliQr CEO Gaurav Manglik will present "ISM405: The Three Degrees of Freedom of the Cloud Drives the Need for Application-Defined Management" on Thurs., Oct. 8, from 1:30-2:30 p.m. PT in Delfino 4005. CliQr product demonstrations and real-world use cases run daily in the booth. 
"CliQr is delighted to participate at AWS re:Invent for the fourth consecutive year," said Gaurav Manglik, co-founder and CEO at CliQr. "AWS and CliQr share a common goal of re-thinking how easily IT can deploy and manage a broad range of enterprise applications in the cloud, making it the de facto compute solution for IT and business." 
Manglik's Oct. 8 educational session, "The Three Degrees of Freedom of the Cloud Drives the Need for Application-Defined Management," discusses why an application-centric cloud-management system is essential to the lifecycle management of -- on average in a Global 2000 organization -- more than 5,000 applications and more than 54,000 possible EC2 instances. The session will cover: Challenges posed by three interrelated degrees of freedom in the cloud: application proliferation, execution venue diversification and the increase in the rate of change Ways to define each application's deployment and management requirements, and use this metadata to dynamically provision infrastructure resources based on needs of the application 
About CliQr Technologies CliQr is a leading provider of application-defined cloud management solutions. Offering full lifecycle management delivered in a single, intuitive packaged platform, CliQr enables businesses to easily and efficiently model, migrate and manage one to many applications, users, and clouds. CliQr's application-defined technology de-couples applications from the complexity of hybrid cloud environments, allowing them to be fluidly moved and managed to and between any cloud. CliQr's patented and patent-pending technology and its global partners help dozens of leading brands in healthcare, manufacturing and technology markets manage their cloud application lifecycles over 10 different cloud types. Headquartered in Santa Clara, California, with locations in Canada, India and Czech Republic, CliQr is backed by Polaris Partners, Foundation Capital, Google Ventures and TransLink Capital. For additional information, visit www.cliqr.com .
